Consideration 2: Language and Experience

When formulating objectives for learners, ensure that the language used is based on their unique world of experience.

This approach is a cornerstone of building effective scaffolding, enabling students to progressively grasp and pursue objectives with growing autonomy.

Tip: Integrate objectives with learning assignments, transforming them into tangible, achievable student tasks.

Digitally, utilise straightforward, shared lists of objectives or rubrics, offering individual learners the ability to interact with them securely.

Maintain clear and accessible knowledge sources.
